text: In this video, we will be going over
how to play Fortnite.

We will cover topics such
as the object of the game,
getting started, and general gameplay.
Fortnite is an online battle royale game

that blends together the
elements of survival,
scavenging, and exploration,

crowning the last player
standing as the winner.
To begin playing, start by selecting
your game mode of choice:
solos, duos, or squads.
Before the match begins,
you will be loaded into a pregame lobby
for less than one minute to practice.
Once the official match begins,

all players will spawn in
the Fortnite Battle Bus,
which flies across the entirety of the map
for players to jump out on command

and select their location
of choice to land at.

Once you have glided down
to your location of choice,
you are tasked with looting various items,
including weapons, healing, and materials,

all used to further
your placement in game.

You will notice that every
item has varying rarities,

which can be determined
by the color of the item,
from common to epic.
As the match progresses,
players attempt to eliminate each other,
and a storm that causes damage
will close in randomly across the map,

forcing distanced players to
move in closer to one another.

You can use your collection
of materials to build walls,
ramps, floors, and cones

to serve as a means of
protection from enemy shots.

Remember to continuously
remain distant from the storm

to avoid damage, because
it progressively becomes

more detrimental to your
health with passing time.
In the event you do take damage,

you can use healing items
such as bandages, med kits,

and shield potions to
regenerate your health.

Your mission is to survive
the entirety of the match
and remain the last player standing
in order to receive a Victory Royale.
